theoryText: Many fans theorize that the G-8 Arc should be considered semi-canon or could be incorporated into the official One Piece storyline. The arc's quality, character development, and thematic connections to the main story make it worthy of canonical status. Some believe Oda may have consulted on or approved the arc's story, given its unusually high quality for filler content.
author: One Piece Fan Community
evidence: The arc was acknowledged in the 'Episode of Merry' special, the only filler arc to receive such recognition
Originally conceived as a theatrical film by series director Konosuke Uda
The arc's themes of the Going Merry's condition foreshadow Water 7
High production quality and writing that matches manga arcs

theoryTitle: Jonathan Should Return in the Main Story
theoryText: Fans theorize that Vice Admiral Jonathan deserves to appear in the manga/canon storyline due to his popularity and unique characterization as a strategic, honorable Marine. Some believe he could play a role in future Marine-focused arcs or appear during major conflicts like Marineford or the Final War. His character serves as a counterpoint to more extreme Marines like Akainu (despite being Akainu's protégé).
author: One Piece Fan Community
evidence: Jonathan is consistently ranked as fans' favorite anime-only character
His tactical brilliance would make him valuable in major battles
He represents a more nuanced view of Marine justice that Oda explores in canon
His relationship with Akainu (as his protégé) creates story potential

theoryTitle: Condoriano is Part of the Clan of D
theoryText: A humorous fan theory that jokingly claims 'Con D. Oriano' is a legitimate member of the Will of D clan. This meme theory plays on Usopp's lie in the arc where he claims Shepherd is actually a Straw Hat crew member named 'Condoriano.' Fans humorously elevate this joke by formatting his name as 'Con D. Oriano' to match the naming convention of D clan members like Gol D. Roger and Monkey D. Luffy. Some fans create elaborate joke lore about Condoriano's 'legendary' status.
author: One Piece Meme Community
evidence: The 'D' naming format is commonly used in the joke
Usopp's lies often become reality in One Piece, creating ironic potential
The meme has become one of the most enduring One Piece inside jokes
Fans create elaborate joke power-scaling and lore for the character

theoryText: Fans theorize that the G-8 Arc intentionally foreshadows themes and plot points from the upcoming Water 7 and Enies Lobby arcs. The Going Merry's damage is emphasized throughout G-8, the crew faces a Marine fortress (like Enies Lobby), and the arc explores themes of loyalty and difficult decisions. Some believe the anime staff knew what was coming in the manga and planted these seeds intentionally.
author: One Piece Analysis Community
evidence: The Going Merry's deteriorating condition is highlighted
Marine fortress setting parallels Enies Lobby
Themes of teamwork and problem-solving over brute force
The arc was made when the anime staff knew Water 7 was coming in the manga

theoryTitle: Netflix Live-Action Could Make G-8 Canon
theoryText: Fans theorize that Netflix's live-action One Piece adaptation could incorporate the G-8 Arc into its storyline, effectively making it canon to the live-action continuity. This would allow the show to flesh out the Marines, provide breathing room between major arcs, and introduce beloved characters like Jonathan. Some fans suggest it could be condensed into 1-2 episodes and placed after Skypiea.
author: One Piece Adaptation Community
evidence: Netflix showrunner Matt Owens has shown willingness to expand on canon material
The arc provides natural pacing between Skypiea and Water 7
It introduces Marine perspectives that enrich world-building
Jonathan and Jessica could become fan-favorite characters in live-action
The arc's self-contained nature makes it easy to adapt
